name: A TRIDENT Quiz | Words in Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters in "TRIDENT", find a 4-letter word meaning to take a trip in a car, or something you play on at the amusement park.
questions.explanation:
Ride.

	To ride means to take a trip or a journey in something, like a car or a bicycle.  A ride is also something at an amusement park that you ride on, like a roller coaster or a ferris wheel.

questions.text: Find a 5-letter word, using only letters in "TRIDENT", for a place to eat.
questions.explanation:
Diner.

	A diner is a place where you can eat.  Diners were very popular in the 1950s, but they can still be seen today.  Diners are usually known to have burgers, fries, and shakes, though diners can sell much more than that!

questions.text: Using only letters in "TRIDENT", find a 4-letter word for a little divot made when something hits something, such as when a rock hits a car.
questions.explanation:
Dent.

	A dent is defined as a small hollow or impression in a surface, usually when something hits it.  It can also be called an "indent".

questions.text: Using only letters in "TRIDENT", find a 3-letter word for something a man wears around his neck.
questions.explanation:
Tie.

	A tie is a long piece of fabric that is worn around the neck.  It is usually worn with a button-up shirt, and sometimes with a suit.  The way to make a tie stay on is to "tie" it, which means to make it into a knot.

questions.text: Using only letters in "TRIDENT", find a 4-letter word for something you sleep in while camping.
questions.explanation:
Tent.

	A tent is like a small portable house that can be used when camping.  Tents come in all different shapes and sizes.  Some are small enough just for one person, and others are very large, with an entry way, and enough space to have many people sleep in it.

questions.text: Using only letters in "TRIDENT", find a 4-letter word for the ebb and flow of the ocean.
questions.explanation:
Tide.

	The ebb is the low tide of the ocean, and the flow is the high tide.  Tides move the ocean up and down, and they can change based on where the moon is in the sky.

questions.text: Using only letters in "TRIDENT", find a 4-letter word meaning a wheel on a car or what happens to you when you have done lots of work.
questions.explanation:
Tire.

	A tire (also spelled "tyre" in some countries) is a rubber wheel that is put on a car so it can drive.  Most cars have four tires, and some have a spare one, just in case.  Also, if you "tire" out, that means you are exhausted, and may need a nap.

questions.text: Find a 3-letter word that means to lose your life, using only letters in "TRIDENT".
questions.explanation:
Die.

	If you lose your life, you die, or expire.  If you have lost your life, you are referred to as "dead".

questions.text: Using only letters in "TRIDENT", find a 3-letter word for a number that comes after nine and before eleven.
questions.explanation:
Ten.

	Ten comes after nine, and before eleven, when counting.  "Ten" is the only number that can be spelled using letters in "TRIDENT".

questions.text: Using only letters in "TRIDENT", find a 4-letter word for the skin on a fruit, like the green part of a watermelon.
questions.explanation:
Rind.

	A rind is the skin on a fruit, a meat, or a cheese.  For instance, some bologna has a red plastic thing around it that cannot be eaten.  This is called a rind.  The green part of a watermelon is also a rind.  Some cheeses also have rinds that you cannot eat.
